meanings.definition: A state of confusion or disorder.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was in bouleversements after the fire alarm went off.
meanings.sent2: The city experienced bouleversements after the unexpected storm hit.
meanings.sent3: Trying to find my way in the dark room was a real bouleversements!
meanings.sent4: The arrival of the new manager brought bouleversements to the company.
meanings.sent5: The bouleversements in the library made it impossible to find the book I needed.

meanings.definition: A sudden and drastic change or upheaval.
meanings.sent1: The announcement of the merger caused bouleversements in the stock market.
meanings.sent2: The political landscape experienced bouleversements after the election results.
meanings.sent3: The bouleversements in the cafeteria menu left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The discovery of a new species brought bouleversements to the scientific community.
meanings.sent5: The sudden bouleversements in the weather caught everyone off guard.
